title: Exodus to the Metaverse
sub_head: The Passover Seder calls on us to traverse time and space to commiserate with historical Jews.
body:
Countless Jewish ideas and concepts have made the world a better place. Concern for the downtrodden, welcome of the stranger, universal literacy, the weekend and much else get their start in the Torah. So do many customs that have retained their urgency—from the sabbatical to laws about the ethical treatment of animals.
Now comes the metaverse, an online environment in which users experience a new world through virtual reality and other novel technologies. This could allow people to attend events they otherwise couldn’t: Imagine going to a James Taylor concert without having to put on a denim shirt. Mark Zuckerberg renamed his company Meta and invested billions in developing the idea.
